noun.description: A waterproof filler and sealant, used in building work and repairs.
examples: use silicone caulk to ensure that you have an all-season moisture seal

verb.description: Seal (a gap or seam) with a waterproof filler and sealant.
examples: caulk all cracks between the trim and siding or masonry

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense copulate, used of birds): from Old Northern French cauquer, caukier, variant of cauchier tread, press with force, from Latin calcare tread, from calx, calc- heel.
